Copyvillain

Research

Wikipedia

My Wikipedia research centers around questions of organization, communication and power in the Wikipedia project. My contribution to the Institute of Network Cultures' Critical Point of View focused on the early relationship between Wikipedia and its potential competitor Gnupedia. I also described some of the rhetorical strategies employed by Wikipedia editors in First Monday.

Legal Research

My contribution to the ongoing analysis of the intersection of Copyright Law and digital communications has focused on examining how maker/hacker culture has built on ideas previously explored in the Critical Legal Studies movement. I have published on these issues, along with my collaborator Tori Ekstrand, in Cardozo Arts and Entertainment Law Journal and IDEA: The Intellectual Property Law Review
